title: Huygens (spacecraft)
summary: Huygens (/ˈhɔɪɡənz/ HOY-gənz) was an atmospheric entry robotic  space probe that landed successfully on Saturn's moon Titan in 2005. Built and operated by the European Space Agency (ESA), launched by NASA, it was part of the Cassini–Huygens mission and became the first spacecraft to land on Titan and the farthest landing from Earth a spacecraft has ever made.[2] The probe was named after the 17th-century Dutch astronomer Christiaan Huygens,[3] who discovered Titan in 1655.
